trans-unit.source:
\n

Provides a base type converter for nonfloating-point numerical types.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxx x xxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxx$xxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Determines if this converter can convert an object in the given source type to the native type of the converter.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxxx xx xxxx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxx xxxxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source: true if this converter can perform the operation; otherwise, false.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxxx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxx$ $xxxxxx$xxxxx$$xxxxxx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Returns a value indicating whether this converter can convert an object to the given destination type using the context.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx x xxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source: true if this converter can perform the operation; otherwise, false.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxxx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxx$ $xxxxxx$xxxxx$$xxxxxx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Converts the given object to the converter's native type.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx$x xxxxxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source: value is not a valid value for the target type.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx xxx x xxxxx xxxxx xxx xxx xxxxxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Converts the specified object to another type.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The type to convert the object to.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xx.
